body: @iSazonov not sure if the broken builds are to do with my changes? There shouldn't be anything functionally different, and the build agents don't seem to be even giving compile errors. Have you seen this before at all?

@vexx32, your last commit had 12 failures in `PowerShell-CI-macos`
(These are 5 of the failures)

Send-MailMessage DRT Unit Tests.Can send mail message using named parameters with mandatory parameters
```powershell
Expected exactly 'user01@example.com', but got $null.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Send-MailMessage.Tests.ps1: line 136
136:         $mail.FromAddress | Should -BeExactly $InputObject.From
```

```powershell
257:             $mail.Priority | Should -BeExactly "urgent"
```

```powershell
269:             $mail.Headers["content-type"] | Should -BeLike "text/html*"

```


ðŸ‘€ I don't... think that should be related to this at all? Did something change with the mail things?

@TravisEz13 has something changed with the build agents since Saturday/Sunday? 

#9743 is failing with the same errors.
@vexx32 	No code change.  An agent change seems likely.
@PoshChan Please retry linux tests
@TravisEz13, I do not understand the build target(s) `linux tests`; I only allow `static`, `windows`, `macos`, `linux`, `all`

Too tempting to clean it as I work... better to clean it in advance. ðŸ˜‰
